distorCont.rpOrgName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

onLineSrc.orDesc: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.
Assessor's parcel data for town of Pepperell, MA. Developed from existing digital data. M232TaxPar

idCitation.resTitle: Parcel data for Pepperell, MA complying with Level 3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts
citRespParty.displayName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Assessors parcel data for the Town of Pepperell, MA. Developed from existing digital data and original Mylar Assessor's maps. Geometry and attribute data updates completed August 31, 2023 based on Fiscal Year 2024 Assessor's CAMA information and Middlesex North Registry of Deeds plans. Additional easements digitized from registered plans. Right of Ways adjusted based on state, county, or municipal layouts or acceptance vote records.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: The Town of Pepperell, MA. Original mylar tax map compilation and boundary maintenance though 2017 by Gordon E. Ainsworth & Associates. Data maintenance performed by the Northern Middlesex Council of Governments (NMCOG) 2017 through 2020. Data maintenance 2021 through 2024 performed by Town of Pepperell GIS department. MassGIS Level 3 compliance obtained by Cartographic Associates, Inc. in 2012.

LegConsts.useLimit: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.
LegConsts.othConsts: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis

Consts.useLimit: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Updates through 2022 were aligned to 2020 Pictometry imagery (estimated +/- 3' horizontal accuracy in some locations). However, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

prcStep.stepDesc: Assessor's .txt extract imported into the MassGIS M232Assess schema within Access. LOC_ID were populated into the new extract from the original M232Assess table by joining CAMA_ID. LOT_SIZE was divided by 100. TOWN_ID was populated. Removed quotes and double-spaces from OWNER1 field. Added leading zeros to USE_CODE where necessary. Ran TRIM function on STYLE field to remove extraneous characters and spaces.

The new Assessor's extract was loaded into an empty M232Assess fGDB table using ArcCatalog. New plans dated 1/1/2013 through 2/7/2013 were downloaded from http://www.masslandrecords.com/MiddlesexSouth. Plans were georeferenced and/or digitized using COGO in ArcMap. Parcel boundaries were revised using ArcMap editing and topology tools. New LOC_ID were generated for parcels with significant boundary changes. Attributes were updated.

Parcel polygons and water, wetland and ROW lines converted with ESRI tools to project, dissolve, copy, calculate, and generally manipulate the ESRI version of the data to meet Mass GIS Level III standards. The source data is not changed by this process.
Easements, Rights of Way, common ownership hooks, and other features were digitized using georeferenced scanned copies of the Assessor's latest Mylar maps.

The new Assessor's extract was loaded into an empty M232Assess fGDB table using ArcCatalog. New plans dated 2/7/2013 through 6/1/2015 were downloaded from http://www.masslandrecords.com/MiddlesexSouth. Plans were georeferenced and/or digitized using COGO in ArcMap. Parcel boundaries were revised using ArcMap editing and topology tools. New LOC_ID were generated for parcels with significant boundary changes. Attributes were updated.

dataSource.srcDesc: February 7, 2013, through January 10, 2019 extracts of the Pepperell Assessor's Patriot database.
This GIS dataset represents a digital version of assessor tax maps that were previously converted and processed into a GIS file by the Northern Middlesex Council of Governments.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Identifies parcels to be excluded from level 3 match rate calculation requirements
attr.attrdefs: MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1

edom.edomvd: Polygon excluded from match to assessor database
Polygon not excluded from matching to assessor record

attr.attrdef: Identifies the kind of polygon in the tax parcel layer.
attr.attrdefs: MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1

edom.edomvd: Dissolved "FEE" parcels with common ownership (tax record)
Railroad Right-of-way with an associated link to assessor table
Water feature with boundary coincident with a parcel
Private ROW that does not overlap onto other taxable parcels and is not an easement.
Right-of-way that does not overlap tax parcel polygons.

attr.attrdef: Identifies parcel boundaries with a discrepancy when compared to orthoimage base map.
attr.attrdefs: MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1

edom.edomvd: Compilation discrepancy is acceptable. (only entered by MassGIS)
Discrepancy checked by compiler and is correct.

attr.attrdef: Parcel ID that appears on the assessor map.

attr.attrdef: Map number of assessor's map sheet which feature appears on.
attr.attrdefs: MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1

attr.attrdef: Identifying information for plan used to update digital file.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Three digit town identification number used by MassGIS.

attr.attrdef: Concatenation of X and Y coordinates of a point inside the polygon.

overview.eaover: For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1. http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/standards/standard-parcels.html
